clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing Remimazolam Tosilate and Propofol for Intravenous General Anaesthesia in Operations

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out the optimal dose for Remimazolam Tosilate as an intravenous general anaesthetic drug in operations and to determine its efficacy and safety profile comparing to propofol.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an multi-center，double-blinded，parallel and control study using Remimazolam or propofol for anesthesia in operations.Subjects are randomized to different treatment groups (including 3 for Remimazolam Tosilate and 1 for propofol) and anaesthetics are pumped contimuously into bodies.Analgesics and muscle relaxants are permitted during operations.Efficacy，safety and pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic profiles of Remimazolam Tosilate are to be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: successful anaesthesia rate as measured by the proportion of subjects who experienced succesful anesthesia during operations
primary_outcome.time_frame: an average of 3 hours (immediately after opaerations)

secondary_outcome.measure: bispectral index(BIS) during anaesthesia as measured by bispectral index machine
recovery time as measured by time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: an average of 3 hours (after cessation of anesthetics pumping)

secondary_outcome.measure: induction time as measured by time

other_outcome.measure: rate of improper-depths sedation as measured by the proportion of subjects who experienced too-deep or too-shallow anesthesia during operations
rate of hypotention as measured by the proportion of subjects who experienced hypotention during operations
rate of hyoxemia as measured by the proportion of subjects who experienced hyoxemia during operations

arm_group.description: IV pumping of Remimazolam Tosilate at 6mg/kg/h for anesthesia induction
intravenous pumping of Remimazolam Tosilate at 12mg/kg/h for anesthesia induction
intravenous pumping of Remimazolam Tosilate at 18mg/kg/h for anesthesia induction
single IV bolus of Propofol at 2.0-2.5mg/kg for anesthesia induction
